greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest k such that gcd(n,k) = gcd(n+1,k+1).
comment: a(n) = least m>0 such that gcd(n!+1+m,n-m) = 1.  [_Clark Kimberling_, Jul 21 2012]
a(n-1)+1 = A053669(n) = Smallest k >= 2 coprime to n = Smallest prime not dividing n.
Note that a(n) is equal to A235918(n+1) for the first 209 values of n. The first difference occurs at n=210 and A235921 lists the integers n for which a(n) differs from A235918(n+1).
link: Clark Kimberling & Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10001 (Terms up to n=1000 from Kimberling)
program: (Scheme) (define (A071222 n) (let loop ((k 1)) (cond ((= (gcd n k) (gcd (+ n 1) (+ k 1))) k) (else (loop (+ 1 k)))))) ;; _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 26 2014
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Jun 10 2002
ext: Added a(0)=1. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 19 2014
